title: Police arrest three men in connection with car who drove into people on Aberystwyth pier
text:
Three men have been arrested in connection with an incident where a car was driven into pedestrians on the Aberrystwyth sea front today.

Police attended the Marine Terrace area at 4.50am after receiving reports from members of the public about a car 'driving erratically and dangerously' in the area.

They were told a dark green car had 'possibly collided with some pedestrians and the pillar of a shelter on the prom' after 'some sort of altercation' in the area.

Police said that a dark green car was seen driving erratically and dangerously and that it had possibly collided with pedestrians on the Aberrystwyth sea front, around 4.50am

The driver moves back round and people appear to be hiding behind other to escape the snaking car

One man was taken to the town's Bronglais Hospital for his 'minor injuries' which are not non-life threatening, according to the Welsh ambulance service.

They received a call from police just before 5am before attending the scene and taking the victim to hospital.

And the three men, who were previously in custody, have been arrested on suspicion of affray and driving offences.

A group of men appear to arguing just outside the car with the door flung wide open before two of them jump inside. Police were called to the Marine Terrace area after receiving reports of a car driving erratically

One of the group is seen sprinting across the car's path with some kind of weapon in his hand while another stands in the road and others loiter nearby

A video of the incident has emerged which shows the car driving along the road before forming a figure of eight around parked cars. It snakes across the pavement which is lined with parked cars.

While the vehicle narrowly missing other cars, people quickly dash to hide behind other ones as the rogue driver moves in an unpredictable way.

Moments later, there appears to be a scuffle with a few men who seem to be trying to get into the car.

One of them is seen holding a weapon-like object similar to a piece of wood and thumps another person with it.

A man has been left with 'minor injuries' after the reckless driver stormed the pavement this morning

The vehicle reverses for a brief moment before a couple of the men jump in with the door wide open. They then speed off.

Anyone who witnessed the incident or has any information is asked to contact Dyfed-Powys Police. You can make a report online at: http://bit.ly/DPPReportOnline, by email at: contactcentre@dyfed-powys.pnn.police.uk, or by calling 101.
description: Three men have been arrested in connection with the car which drove into  pedestrians on Aberystwyth pier in Wales and left a man with 'minor injuries' around 4.50am today.
